data.title: Basketball: Shaquille O'Neal Profile and Information.
meta_keywords: basketball: shaquille o'neal profile and information.
data.meta_description: Shaquille O'Neal player profile, information, titles won, greatest moments, pictures, posters and more.
data.text:
Full Name: Shaquille Rashaun O'Neal

Nicknames: Shaq, The Diesel, Shaq Fu, The Big Aristotle, Superman

Birth date: March 6, 1972

Place of Birth: Newark, New Jersey, USA

Plays: Right-handed

Teams: Orlando Magic (1992-93 to 1995-96), Los Angeles Lakers (1996-97 to 2003-04), Miami Heat (2004-05 to midseason 2007-08), Phoenix Suns (midseason 2007-08 to 2008-09), Cleveland Cavaliers (2009-10), Boston Celtics (2010-11)

Complete NBA Seasons: 16

Team Titles won:

NBA Championships: 4 - 1999-00, 2000-01 and 2001-02 with the Lakers, 2005-06 with the Heat

Olympic Gold Medals: 1 - 1996 Atlanta with USA Team

World Championships: 1 - 1994 Canada with USA Team

Personal Titles and Awards:

NBA Finals MVP: 3 - 2000, 2001 and 2002

NBA Season MVP: 1 - 1999-00

NBA All-Star Game MVP: 2 - 2000 and 2004

All NBA First Team: 8 - 1997-98, 1999-00 to 2005-06

Rookie of the Year: 1 - 1992-93

Selected for NBA All-Star Game: 14 - 1993 to 1998 and 2000 to 2007 (there was no ASG in 1999)

NBA scoring leader: 2 - 1994-95 and 1999-00

One of 50 Greatest Players in NBA History (1996).

Career highlights:

- Shaq took three different teams to a total of 6 NBA Finals, winning four of them: In 1995 his Orlando Magic were swept by Hakeem Olajuwon and the Houston Rockets; later with the 2000, 2001 and 2002 Lakers Shaq got the 4th Three-peat in NBA history. The 2004 Lakers that also included Kobe Bryant, Gary Payton and Karl Malone were one of the biggest deceptions ever, giving the Detroit Pistons little opposition in the FInals. After a tumultuous departure from L.A. he got another championship with the Heat in 2006. The team led by Shaq and Dwyane Wade was 0-2 with Dirk Nowitzki's Mavericks before winning 4 in a row for the title.

Best Websites: Lakers Universe, LakersWeb.net

Other interesting information: -

-
